(on loan from [[Liverpool F.C.|Liverpool]]) | clubnumber = 15 | youthyears1 = 2005–2013 | youthclubs1 = [[Red Star Belgrade]] | years1 = 2013–2016 | clubs1 = [[Red Star Belgrade]] | caps1 = 31 | goals1 = 5 | years2 = 2014 | clubs2 = → [[FK Kolubara|Kolubara]] (loan) | caps2 = 5 | goals2 = 2 | years3 = 2016– | clubs3 = [[Liverpool F.C.|Liverpool]] | caps3 = 8 | goals3 = 0 | clubs4 = → [[Red Star Belgrade]] (loan) | years4 = 2016 | caps4 = 8 | goals4 = 1 | years5 = 2018 | clubs5 = → [[Cardiff City F.C.|Cardiff City]] (loan) | caps5 = 13 | goals5 = 1 | years6 = 2018– | clubs6 = → [[Hertha BSC]] (loan) | caps6 = 14 | goals6 = 3 | nationalyears1 = 2011–2012 | nationalteam1 = [[Serbia national under-16 football team|Serbia U16]] | nationalcaps1 = 4 | nationalgoals1 = 2 | nationalyears2 = 2012 | nationalteam2 = [[Serbia national under-17 football team|Serbia U17]] | nationalcaps2 = 1 | nationalgoals2 = 1 | nationalyears3 = 2014–2015 | nationalteam3 = [[Serbia national under-19 football team|Serbia U19]] | nationalcaps3 = 3 | nationalgoals3 = 0 | nationalyears4 = 2015 | nationalteam4 = [[Serbia national under-20 football team|Serbia U20]] | nationalcaps4 = 7 | nationalgoals4 = 0 | nationalyears5 = 2015– | nationalteam5 = [[Serbia national under-21 football team|Serbia U21]] | nationalcaps5 = 13 | nationalgoals5 = 0 | nationalyears6 = 2016– | nationalteam6 = [[Serbia national football team|Serbia]] | nationalcaps6 = 8 | nationalgoals6 = 0 | pcupdate = 23:02, 2 March 2019 (UTC) | ntupdate = 9 June 2018 | medaltemplates = {{Medal|Gold|[[FIFA U-20 World Cup]]|[[2015 FIFA U-20 World Cup|2015]]}} }} '''Marko Grujić''' ({{lang-sr-Cyrl|Марко Грујић}}, {{IPA-sh|mâːrko ɡrûːjitɕ|pron}}; born 13 April 1996) is a Serbian professional [[Association football|footballer]] who plays as a [[midfielder]] for [[Hertha BSC]] on loan from [[Liverpool F.C.|Liverpool]], and the [[Serbia national football team|Serbia national team]]. A native of [[Belgrade]], Grujić started his career with his hometown club [[Red Star Belgrade]], progressing through their [[youth system]] to the [[first team]] squad. He made his professional debut in 2013, and won the [[Serbian SuperLiga|SuperLiga]] title in his final season with Red Star before completing a £5.1 million move to Liverpool. Grujić is a Serbian international, and represented Serbia at every youth level from under-16 upwards before making his full international debut in May 2016. He was part of the [[Serbia national under-20 football team|Serbian side]] which won the [[2015 FIFA U-20 World Cup|2015 U-20 World Cup]]. ==Club career== ===Red Star Belgrade=== Grujić was born in [[Belgrade]], [[FR Yugoslavia]] (now [[Serbia]]) and is a product of [[Red Star Belgrade]], where he went through the youth program, passed all categories and was the captain of his generation. He made his professional debut for Red Star on 26 May 2013, in a [[Serbian SuperLiga]] match versus [[FK Vojvodina|Vojvodina]].{{cite web |url=http://www.crvenazvezdafk.com/vesti/izvestaji/7369/Vojvodina+-+Crvena+zvezda+3%3A0+(1%3A0).html|script-title=sr:Војводина – Црвена звезда 3:0 (1:0)|website=Red Star Belgrade official website|language=Serbian|date=26 May 2013|accessdate=3 October 2014}} On 17 May 2015, Grujić signed a three-year contract with Red Star to last until 2018.[http://www.rtv.rs/sr_lat/sport/fudbal/grujic-i-jovic-do-2018.-u-zvezdi_600503.html Grujić and Jovic by 2018 in Zvezda] Radio Televizija Vojvodine: ''Grujić i Jović do 2018. u Zvezdi'' {{sr icon}} 17 May 2015 Grujić scored his first senior goal on 26 September 2015 against [[FK Novi Pazar|Novi Pazar]] in a 2–0 victory; he also assisted [[Aleksandar Katai]] for the second goal.{{citeweb|url=https://www.onefootball.com/en/match/fk-red-star-belgrade-vs-fk-novi-pazar-overview-123-444846?period=FullTime&variable=g2|title=Red Star vs Novi Pazar report|publisher=onefootball.com}} Grujić was a part of an unprecedented run of Red Star victories, as the club set a new record for the number of consecutive victories (19), ending the first half of the season without defeat.{{cite web|url=http://www.espnfc.us/blog/espn-fc-united-blog/68/post/2758612/miodrag-bozovic-is-breaking-records-at-red-star-belgrade|author=Michael Yokhin|title=ESPN: ''Miodrag 'The Count' Bozovic breaking records at Red Star Belgrade''|date=15 December 2015|accessdate=24 February 2016}} ===Liverpool=== Throughout autumn, Grujić was scouted by a number of high-profile European teams, including [[Liverpool F.C.|Liverpool]], [[Internazionale]], [[Juventus]], [[Chelsea F.C.|Chelsea]], and [[A.C. Milan|Milan]]. [[List of Liverpool F.C. managers|Liverpool manager]] [[Jürgen Klopp]] called Grujić personally to convince him to switch to [[Anfield]], but initially Grujić's father was against his son moving to Liverpool.{{cite web|url=http://www.kurir.rs/sport/fudbal/terzicu-ne-diraj-mi-sina-clanak-2069371|title=OTAC MARKA GRUJIĆA EKSKLUZIVNO ZA KURIR: Terziću, ne diraj mi sina|author=Aleksandar Radonić|language=Serbian|date=23 December 2015|accessdate=24 February 2016}} Klopp's assistant, [[Željko Buvač]], flew to Belgrade to speak with Grujić and on 6 January 2016, it was confirmed that Grujić completed his move to [[Premier League]] side [[Liverpool F.C.|Liverpool]], signing a five-year deal for a reported fee of £5.1 million.{{cite web|last1=Bell|first1=Tom|title=Marko Grujic confirmed as Liverpool manager Jurgen Klopp's first signing|url=http://www.espnfc.com/story/2780433/marko-grujic-confirmed-as-liverpool-player|publisher=[[ESPN FC]]|accessdate=12 January 2016|date=6 January 2016}}{{cite news|title=Marko Grujic: Liverpool sign Red Star Belgrade midfielder|url=https://www.bbc.com/sport/0/football/35244115|accessdate=6 January 2016|publisher=BBC Sport}} Upon joining, Grujić hailed Klopp for convincing him to join and told the press, "I would choose Liverpool over [[Real Madrid C.F.|Real Madrid]] and [[FC Barcelona|Barcelona]]."{{Cite web|title = Marko Grujic reveals his Liverpool role, hints at Lazar Markovic's future – This Is Anfield|url = http://www.thisisanfield.com/2016/02/marko-grujic-reveals-his-liverpool-role-hints-at-markovic-future/|website = This Is Anfield|access-date = 24 February 2016|language = en-GB|first = Jack|last = Lusby}} He was immediately loaned back to Red Star until the end of the season for a fee of £740,000, and won the [[Serbian SuperLiga|SuperLiga]] with Red Star while on loan. Grujić finished the season with 29 appearances, 6 goals, 7 assists and was voted into the SuperLiga Team of the Year for his contribution to Red Star's unbeaten season. On 20 August 2016, Grujić made his [[Premier League]] debut for [[Liverpool F.C.|Liverpool]] in a 2–0 loss against [[Burnley F.C.|Burnley]], coming on in the place of [[Adam Lallana]] in the 78th minute.{{Cite web|url=https://www.bbc.com/sport/football/37067882|title=Burnley 2–0 Liverpool|last=Bevan|first=Chris|date=20 August 2016|website=BBC.com|publisher=[[BBC]]|access-date=21 August 2016}} ====Loan to Cardiff City==== On 17 January 2018, Grujić joined [[EFL Championship|Championship]] side [[Cardiff City F.C.|Cardiff City]] on loan for the remainder of the 2017–18 season.{{cite web |url=http://www.walesonline.co.uk/sport/football/transfer-news/liverpool-fc-star-marko-grujic-14167521 |title=Liverpool FC star Marko Grujic signs for Cardiff City and describes it as 'breakthrough moment' of his career |publisher=WalesOnline |author=Tom Coleman |date=17 January 2018 |accessdate=17 January 2018}} He made his debut for the club three days later, playing in a 0–0 draw with [[Sheffield Wednesday F.C.|Sheffield Wednesday]].{{cite web |url=https://www.bbc.co.uk/sport/football/42671933 |title=Sheffield Wednesday 0–0 Cardiff City |publisher=BBC Sport |date=20 January 2018 |accessdate=20 January 2018}} Grujić's first goal for Cardiff came in a 2–1 home victory over [[Barnsley F.C.|Barnsley]] on 6 March 2018, scoring from range just after the start of the second half.{{cite web |url=https://www.bbc.co.uk/sport/football/43206633 |title=Cardiff City 2–1 Barnsley |publisher=BBC Sport |author=Dafydd Pritchard |date=6 March 2018 |accessdate=15 March 2018}}{{cite web|title=Marko Grujic|url=https://www.premierleague.com/players/13985/Marko-Grujic/overview|publisher=Premier League|accessdate=31 January 2017}} ====Loan to Hertha BSC==== On 19 August 2018, Grujić joined [[Bundesliga]] club [[Hertha BSC]] on a one-year loan.{{Cite web|title=Marko Grujic kommt aus Liverpool|trans-title=Marko Grujić joins from Liverpool|date=19 August 2018|accessdate=19 August 2018|publisher=[[Hertha BSC]]|url=https://www.herthabsc.de/de/intern/verpflichtung-marko-grujic/page/14925--17-17-.html}} He scored his first goal for the club on 8 December, netting the only goal in a 1–0 win over [[Eintracht Frankfurt]].{{cite news|url=https://www.bundesliga.com/en/news/Bundesliga/hertha-berlin-eintracht-frankfurt-live-line-ups-stats-luka-jovic-rebic-ibisevic-fantasy-518406.jsp|title=Marko Grujic wins Hertha Berlin all three points against Eintracht Frankfurt|publisher=Bundesliga|date=8 December 2018|accessdate=9 December 2018}} Hertha coach [[Pal Dardai]] hailed Grujić as "by far the best midfielder at Hertha Berlin in 20 years".{{cite news|title=Marko Grujic "by far the best midfielder at Hertha Berlin in 20 years" – Pal Dardai |date=10 December 2018|accessdate=10 December 2018|publisher=Bundesliga|url=https://www.bundesliga.com/en/news/Bundesliga/liverpool-s-marko-grujic-by-far-the-best-midfielder-hertha-berlin-dardai-518902.jsp}} ==International career== Grujić represented Serbia at all youth levels from under-16 to under-21, and was a member of the Serbia squad that won the [[2015 FIFA U-20 World Cup]] in [[New Zealand]].{{citeweb|url=http://www.skysports.com/football/news/11669/10107776/who-is-marko-grujic-we-profile-the-red-star-belgrade-youngster|title=Who is Marko Grujic? We profile Liverpool signing|publisher=skysports.com}} In May 2016, Grujić made his full international debut for the [[Serbia national football team|Serbia national team]] after coming on in place of [[Nemanja Matić]] in a 2–1 win against [[Cyprus national football team|Cyprus]].{{cite web|url=http://www.fss.rs/index.php?id=2021&aid=10348|title=Фудбалски савез Србије – званична веб презентација|website=www.fss.rs}} In May 2018 he was named in Serbia's preliminary squad for the [[2018 FIFA World Cup]] in Russia.{{cite news |url=http://www.fss.rs/index.php?id=2021&aid=13898 |title=Један тим, срцем свим – Младен Крстајић одабрао |trans-title=One team, with all their hearts – Mladen Krstajić selects |website=FSS.rs |publisher=[[Football Association of Serbia]] |date=24 May 2018 |access-date=24 May 2018 |language=Serbian}} In June 2018 he was selected in Serbia's squad for the [[2018 FIFA World Cup|2018 World Cup]],{{cite web | url = https://www.bbc.com/sport/football/44083365 | title = World Cup 2018: All the confirmed squads for this summer's finals in Russia | publisher = BBC Sport | date = 4 June 2018 | accessdate = 25 June 2018}} but he failed to make any appearances there. ==Style of play== Standing at 6-foot-3-inches (1.91 m), Grujić has been described as "tall, rangy, comfortable on the ball and with a good range of passing" and dubbed the "new Matić" because of his likeness in both appearance and position to fellow Serbian defensive midfielder [[Nemanja Matić]]. ==Career statistics== ===Club=== {{updated|end of
